name: Hinterland
description: June 11, 2009 - Update Two new playable Orc classes: Lord (Warrior) or Shaman. Expanded gameplay: Orcs consume twice as much food, learn martial skills faster, manufacture items slower, and the Shaman uses totems to summon creatures. Several new items regardless of character class.
minimum_requirements: Recommended:                      Supported OS: Windows® XP or Vista                         Processor: 1.8 GHz processor or higher                         System Memory: 512 MB RAM Windows XP® (1 GB for Windows® Vista)                         Video Card: 64 MB DirectX 8.1 compatible card                         Hard Disk: 350 MB uncompressed free hard drive space

reviews.review_text: Feels very 90's. Pretty basic, even for an RPG. The town building elements (for resources) adds an extra dimension to the usual hack n slash. Very repetitive, and the various races / roles just change a few variables, no major differences.
Great game wish the devs didint give up on it and add more updates after 09
Good idea, but the game need more time to develop. but nice try
Pretty fun despite it's simplicity. Not a very long game. I'd say it's worth $11. A steal when it's on sale.
This is a fun little village sim, hero hack and slash, its totally worth $10 IMO.

Groundbreaking in scope. Build a town. Recruit townsfolk to move in and work their business or have them quest with you. (up to 2 can join you at a time) You level up, they level up. 3rd person, overhead, hack and slash battles. Drops are limited. Graphically challenged. Weak mini-map.
Awesome game... Maybe a bit hard to play, but really awesome
Best of the Tilted Mill collection. Nice combination of action RPG and city building
Lack of content, controls and mechanics. Basic animations.  Sort of game you might find on newgrounds to play for free but really not worth paying for.
Bad game,no advantages at all,i think.
I spent one hour trying to get this game to run with sound, one minute playing it, and one second uninstalling it.
